com.codename1.rad.controllers

Class FormController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codename1.rad.controllers.Controller
      • com.codename1.rad.controllers.ViewController
        • com.codename1.rad.controllers.FormController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionListener<ControllerEvent>, Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FieldEditorFormController, LoginFormController

    public class FormController
extends ViewController
implements Runnable

    A controller for handling application logic related to a Form.

    Controller Hierarchy

    Controllers have a hierarchy similar to UI components. The ApplicationController is generally the "root" controller. The top-level form controller is a "child" of the application controller. If the user navigates to another form from which they should be able to navigate back, then the new FormController is a "child" of the previous FormController.

    Back Navigation

    If a FormController’s parent controller is also a FormController, then "back" functionality will automatically be connected to its Form. When the user clicks "back", they will automatically navigate to the parent controller’s form.

    Views may also request a "back" navigation by firing a FormController.FormBackEvent, which will propagate up the controller hierarchy to the first FormController, where it will be handled.

    Event Propagation

    Events which are dispatched to a Controller will be propagated to the controller’s parent, and its parent, and so on…​ until the event is consumed, or until it reaches the root. In this way, it is possible to create a catch-all event handler in the ApplicationController that will catch all events in the application that haven’t been consumed by another controller.

    Example

    A FormController for the ChatRoomView. Excerpt from this tutorial,window=top.
    public class ChatFormController extends FormController {

   // Define the "SEND" action for the chat room
   public static final ActionNode send = action(
       enabledCondition(entity-> {
           return !entity.isEmpty(ChatRoom.inputBuffer);
       }),
       icon(FontImage.MATERIAL_SEND)
   );
   public ChatFormController(Controller parent) {
       super(parent);
       Form f = new Form("My First Chat Room", new BorderLayout());

       // Create a "view node" as a UI descriptor for the chat room.
       // This allows us to customize and extend the chat room.
       ViewNode viewNode = new ViewNode(
           actions(ChatRoomView.SEND_ACTION, send)
       );

       // Add the viewNode as the 2nd parameter
       ChatRoomView view = new ChatRoomView(createViewModel(), viewNode, f);
       f.add(CENTER, view);
       setView(f);

       addActionListener(send, evt->{
           evt.consume();
           // ... handle send event

       });
   }
   //...
}

    shannah

      • back

        public void back()

        Goes back to previous form. The previous form is always the parent controller’s form, if the parent controller is a FormController.

        If the current controller is an instance of AutoCloseable, then this will first attempt to call AutoCloseable.close() on the current form first. If it throws an exception, then that exception will be swallowed, but the showBack() action will be cancelled.

      • show

        public void show()

      • showBack

        public void showBack()

        Shows this controller’s form using the "back" animation. If the current controller is an instance of AutoCloseable, then this will first attempt to call AutoCloseable.close() on the current form first. If it throws an exception, then that exception will be swallowed, but the showBack() action will be cancelled.

      • getPathString

        public String getPathString(String separator)

        Gets the full path string to this controller. This allows the controller hierarchy to be described as a path, like a filesystem path.

        1. If the pathName of any controller in the controller hierarchy is null, then that controller is omitted from the path.

        2. Only FormController controllers are included in the path.

        3. If this FormController has no pathName set, then this will return the same path string as the parent controller.

        4. If none of the controllers in the hierarchy (including this one) have a pathName set then this will return an empty string.

        Parameters:
        separator - The path separator
        Returns:
        The path string to this controller.

      • cloneAndReplace

        public static <T extends FormController> T cloneAndReplace(T controller)

        Clones a form controller and replaces it. The provided FormController must implement FormController.CloneableFormController.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of FormController
        Parameters:
        controller - The controller to clone and replace.
        Returns:
        The new FormController. show() method would already have been called.

      • tryCloneAndReplaceCurrentForm

        public static boolean tryCloneAndReplaceCurrentForm()

        Tries to cloneAndReplace(FormController) the current FormController

        Returns:
        True if it succeeds. False if it fails. It will fail either the current form doesn’t have a form controller, or there is no current form.
